com.cleo.lexicom.certmgr.external

Interface ICertManagerRunTime


  • public interface ICertManagerRunTime
    Establishes an interface to Certificate Manager. Refer to ILexiCom.getCertManager().

    Methods provided concentrate primarily on user certificates. This is because trusted CA certificates can be manipulated simply by copying and removing files in the certs/ directory.

      • importUserPKCS12

        void importUserPKCS12(java.lang.String alias,
                      java.io.InputStream pkcs12,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      boolean replace)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Import a PKCS12 stream (user certificate and private key)
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias to be assigned to imported certificate; must be uppercase
        pkcs12 - input PKCS12-formatted stream
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)
        replace - true if alias should be replaced if it already exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • importUserPKCS12

        void importUserPKCS12(java.lang.String alias,
                      java.io.InputStream pkcs12,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      boolean replace,
                      boolean addPassword)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Import a PKCS12 stream (user certificate and private key)
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias to be assigned to imported certificate; must be uppercase
        pkcs12 - input PKCS12-formatted stream
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)
        replace - true if alias should be replaced if it already exists
        addPassword - true if original PKCS12-formatted stream is unprotected
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • importUserCertKey

        void importUserCertKey(java.lang.String alias,
                       java.io.File cert,
                       java.io.File key,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       boolean replace)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Import a user certificate file and corresponding private key file
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias to be assigned to imported certificate; must be uppercase
        cert - input X.509 certificate file (either DER or CER)
        key - input PKCS8-encrypted file (either DER or PEM); can be null if replacing user certificate
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)
        replace - true if alias should be replaced if it already exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • importUserCertKey

                       boolean replace,
                       boolean addPassword)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Import a user certificate file and corresponding private key file
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias to be assigned to imported certificate; must be uppercase
        cert - input X.509 certificate file (either DER or CER)
        key - input PKCS8-encrypted file (either DER or PEM); can be null if replacing user certificate
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)
        replace - true if alias should be replaced if it already exists
        addPassword - true if original PKCS8-encrypted file is unprotected
        Throws:

      • generateCaStoreCert

        void generateCaStoreCert(java.lang.String alias,
                         java.lang.String filename,
                         boolean pgp)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a CA store certificate from an OpenPGP or SSH FTP key
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias to be assigned to imported certificate; must be uppercase
        filename - path to the file to import
        pgp - true if OpenPGP import or false if SSH FTP import
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • generateCaStoreCert

        void generateCaStoreCert(java.lang.String alias,
                         java.lang.String commonName,
                         java.lang.String filename,
                         boolean pgp)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a CA store certificate from an OpenPGP or SSH FTP key
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias to be assigned to imported certificate; must be uppercase
        commonName - specifies common name value if it isn't present in key, or overrides existing key value
        filename - path to the file to import
        pgp - true if OpenPGP import or false if SSH FTP import
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • exportUserPKCS12

        void exportUserPKCS12(java.lang.String alias,
                      java.io.File pkcs12,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      boolean strongProtection,
                      java.lang.String friendlyName,
                      boolean exportChain)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Export a PKCS12 user certificate and private key file
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias of certificate/private key to be exported; must be uppercase
        pkcs12 - output PKCS12-formatted file
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)
        strongProtection - true if pkcas12 file should be formatted with strong protection
        friendlyName - optional name that will display in other Certificate systems, such as MSIE
        exportChain - true if certificate chain should be exported
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • exportUserCert

        void exportUserCert(java.lang.String alias,
                    java.io.File cert,
                    boolean exportChain,
                    boolean base64)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Export a user certificate file
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias of certificate to be exported; must be uppercase
        cert - output X.509 certificate file (either DER or CER or PKCS7 depending on next two params)
        exportChain - true if certificate chain should be exported
        base64 - true if CER format should be used
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • exportUserKey

        void exportUserKey(java.lang.String alias,
                   java.io.File key,
                   java.lang.String password,
                   boolean base64)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Export a user private key file
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias of private key to be exported; must be uppercase
        key - output PKCS8-encrypted certificate file (either DER or PEM depending on next param)
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)
        base64 - true if PEM format should be used
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                          java.io.File key,
                          java.lang.String password)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Export a user private key file in OpenSSL/OpenSSH format
        Parameters:

        key - OpenSSL/OpenSSH key output file
        password - private key password (a.k.a. passphrase)

        java.lang.Exception

      • exportUserPublicKeyOpenSSH

        void exportUserPublicKeyOpenSSH(java.lang.String alias,
                                java.lang.String filename,
                                boolean openSshFormat)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Export a user public key in either OpenSSH FTP or SSH FTP format
        Parameters:
        alias - user alias of public key to be exported; must be uppercase
        filename - OpenSSH FTP or SSH FTP public key output file name
        openSshFormat - true if output format is OpenSSH FTP; false if format is SSH FTP
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • displayCertificate

        java.lang.String displayCertificate(boolean user,
                                    java.lang.String alias,
                                    boolean includeHeader)
        Returns the display description of certificate
        Parameters:
        user - true if user certificate; false if ca certificate
        alias - alias of user or CA certificate
        includeHeader - true if certificate alias and filename should be included

      • displayCertificate

        java.lang.String displayCertificate(boolean user,
                                    java.lang.String alias,
                                    boolean includeHeader,
                                    java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert)
        Returns the display description of certificate
        Parameters:
        user - true if user certificate; false if ca certificate
        alias - alias of user or CA certificate
        includeHeader - true if certificate alias and filename should be included
        cert - certificate to be displayed

      • setCheckRevoked

        void setCheckRevoked(boolean checkRevoked)
        Sets whether the get...() and readCert() methods should check whether the cert has been revoked
        Parameters:
        checkRevoked - true if should check cert revocation; defaults to false

      • isRevoked

           throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks whether any certificate in the chain is revoked
        Parameters:
